description: News, updates and information for the Bailiwick of Guernsey.
title: Guernsey news and updates: 7-11 December 2020
title_page: Guernsey news and updates: 7-11 December 2020 - BBC News
maintext:
An access road to Guernsey's Princess Elizabeth Hospital (PEH) from le Vauquiedor will be closed from Monday for emergency repairs.
Anyone accessing the PEH site will need to use the Oberlands entrance, while access to the Duchess of Kent House will be unaffected, the States of Guernsey said.
No planned date for the road's reopening has been announced.
For those who travel by bus, there will be no buses stopping on the PEH site for the duration of the road closure.
Anyone wishing to catch the bus will have to do so at the nearest offsite bus stops in le Vauquiedor or Ville au Roi, the States confirmed.
The States said next week will be "particularly busy" for the Covid-19 testing team, with some clinics are scheduled to finish at about 21:00 on Tuesday and Thursday.
A spokeswoman asked people with an appointment for a coronavirus swab to "please be patient".
She said: "You may need to leave yourself more time if you are attending the PEH next week for an appointment."
